philosophy:
As an artist, I believe that my work should not merely reflect the world around us, but rather actively disrupt it. Through a fusion of conceptualism and intellectual rigor, I aim to create pieces that probe the very fabric of reality, revealing the fissures and fault lines that underlie our most deeply held assumptions about truth, beauty, and perception. Ultimately, my goal is not simply to provoke, but to prompt – to shake the complacent viewer out of their comfort zone and force them to confront the messy, multifaceted nature of meaning itself.

What I dislike in art is a shallow, sentimental attempt to "capturing" reality through formulaic, surface-level representation. The idea that truth can be distilled into a single, polished image or
backstory: She was born into a family of academics and intellectuals, where critical thinking and debate were the norm. A pivotal moment in her development as an artist came when she stumbled upon a worn copy of the philosopher's "Critique of Judgment" in a dusty library, its pages dog-eared and annotated with cryptic notes that mirrored her own fervent questions about beauty, truth, and perception. This encounter sparked a fire within her, driving her to create works that subverted conventions and challenged the status quo, often using unconventional materials and techniques to represent the fragmented nature of meaning itself.
